QFOrM Comfort: It's a fact that women are anatomically and biomechanically different from men. Unfortunately

column33: a leading sports medicine organisation
column34: Merrell spent years studying how these differences contributed to discomfort and in some cases injury for women wearing men's shoes. So they specifically engineered the midsoles in their Women's shoes to provide the proper support
column35: cushioning
column36: and corrective positioning women need to make possible a more balanced
column37:
natural stride that ensures longer-lasting comfort and reduced wear for each shoe.

they've created two advanced rubber compounds - Trek and TC5+ - that provide sure traction on both wet and dry surfaces in even the most extreme temperature

Barefoot running shoe

column32: these differences are all-too-often ignored. Working with Sport Biomechanics
column33: Inc.
column34: a leading sports medicine organisation
column35: Merrell spent years studying how these differences contributed to discomfort and in some cases injury for women wearing men's shoes. So they specifically engineered the midsoles in their Women's shoes to provide the proper support

column38:
natural stride that ensures longer-lasting comfort and reduced wear for each shoe.
